Course Description: This course will provide a detailed understanding of the fundamentals of human computer interaction including concepts of the user centered design, modern user interfaces, rapid prototyping, usability, and user evaluations.

Course Outcomes.CO1: Have a broad understanding of human computer interaction and latest technologies. Have understanding of perceptual and cognitive basis of human-computer interaction.
Course Outcomes.CO2: Knowledge of user centered design and techniques for rapid prototyping.
Course Outcomes.CO3: Knowledge of evaluating multiple interface alternatives,
Course Outcomes.CO4: Using statistics to analyze data, preparing report to visually present the insights.

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Introduction (History) to HCI and Interaction Design Process
Introduction to User Interfaces, Modern 2D interfaces
Ideation and Design process, User Modelling, User Centered Design
Usability Testing Methods (Fitt's Law, Heuristics etc.), User Study Designs

Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Statistics for HCI Tutorial using SPSS
Statistics for HCI Tutorial using SPSS

Resource Material.Title: Human Computer Inreraction: An Empirical Research Perspective by I. Schott Mackenzie
Research Methods in Human-Computer Interaction, by Jonathan Lazar, Jinjuan Heidi Feng, Harry Hochheiser
3D User Interfaces: Theory and Practice (2nd Edition) (Usability) by Joseph J. LaViola Jr., Ernst Kruijff, Ryan P. McMahan, Doug Bowman, Ivan P. Poupyrev
Interaction Design: Beyond Human-Computer Interaction (4th Edition) by Jenny Preece, Helen Sharp, Yvonne Rogers
